title: Replace zone text input with selectable Uruguay departments in Discover filters

requirements.text: Update the discovery filters UI so the "Zona" filter is a dropdown (select) containing all departments of Uruguay as selectable options, instead of a free-text input.

quotes: En los filtros, añadi en zonas, cada departamento de Uruguay como seleccionable en lugar de tener que escribirlo

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/DiscoverFilters.tsx, the "Zona" field is no longer a text <Input>; it uses the existing Select/SelectItem components.

The zone dropdown includes exactly these Uruguay departments as options: Artigas, Canelones, Cerro Largo, Colonia, Durazno, Flores, Florida, Lavalleja, Maldonado, Montevideo, Paysandú, Río Negro, Rivera, Rocha, Salto, San José, Soriano, Tacuarembó, Treinta y Tres.
Selecting a department updates filters.zone via onFiltersChange with the selected department name as a string.
There is a clear way to represent 'no zone filter' (e.g., an "All" / "Any" option) that sets filters.zone to an empty string so existing filtering logic continues to work.
DiscoverScreen continues to pass the same filters object shape to useDiscoverCandidates without any backend changes required.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose only).
Do not introduce any new backend canisters/services; keep the existing single-actor Motoko backend unchanged unless strictly required by the filter behavior.
nonGoals: Adding city/neighborhood-level zones beyond Uruguay departments.
Changing discovery matching/filtering semantics on the backend.
